mn116:3.2.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, pañca paccekabuddhasatāni imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsino ahesuṁ.
mn116:3.2.en: Once upon a time, five hundred Independent Buddhas dwelt for a long time on this Isigili.

mn116:3.7.en: I shall declare the names of the Independent Buddhas;

mn116:3.8.en: I shall extol the names of the Independent Buddhas;

mn116:3.9.en: I shall teach the names of the Independent Buddhas.

mn116:4.1.pli: “Ariṭṭho nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
mn116:4.1.en: “The independent Buddhas who dwelt for a long time on this Isigili were named Ariṭṭha,

mn116:6.3.en: Independent Buddhas, enders of the leash to existence;

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

dn16:5.12.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekasambuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpārahoti.
dn16:5.12.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; an independent Buddha; a disciple of a Realized One; and a wheel-turning monarch.

dn16:5.12.8.en: And for what reason is an independent Buddha worthy of a monument?

dn16:5.12.9.pli: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato paccekasambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
dn16:5.12.9.en: So that many people will inspire confidence in their hearts, thinking: ‘This is the monument for that independent Buddha!’

dn16:5.12.11.pli: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho.
dn16:5.12.11.en: It is for this reason that an independent Buddha is worthy of a monument.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 16
The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an9.20:8.3.pli: yo ca sataṁ arahantānaṁ bhojeyya, yo cekaṁ paccekabuddhaṁ bhojeyya …pe…
an9.20:8.3.en: It would be more fruitful to feed one Independent Buddha than a hundred perfected ones.

an9.20:8.4.pli: yo ca sataṁ paccekabuddhānaṁ bhojeyya, yo ca tathāgataṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ bhojeyya …pe…
an9.20:8.4.en: It would be more fruitful to feed one Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha than a hundred Independent Buddhas.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9.20
2. The Lion’s Roar
About Velāma

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn142:5.5.en: One gives a gift to an independent Buddha.

mn142:6.1.pli: Tatrānanda, tiracchānagate dānaṁ datvā sataguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, puthujjanadussīle dānaṁ datvā sahassaguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, puthujjanasīlavante dānaṁ datvā satasahassaguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, bāhirake kāmesu vītarāge dānaṁ datvā koṭisatasahassaguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne dānaṁ datvā asaṅkheyyā appameyyā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, ko pana vādo sotāpanne, ko pana vādo sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne, ko pana vādo sakadāgāmissa, ko pana vādo anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne, ko pana vādo anāgāmissa, ko pana vādo arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne, ko pana vādo arahante, ko pana vādo paccekasambuddhe, ko pana vādo tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe.
mn142:6.1.en: Now, Ānanda, gifts to the following persons may be expected to yield the following returns. To an animal, a hundred times. To an unethical ordinary person, a thousand. To an ethical ordinary person, a hundred thousand. To an outsider free of desire for sensual pleasures, 10,000,000,000. But a gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry may be expected to yield incalculable, immeasurable returns. How much more so a gift to a stream-enterer, someone practicing to realize the fruit of once-return, a once-returner, someone practicing to realize the fruit of non-return, a non-returner, someone practicing to realize the fruit of perfection, a perfected one, or an independent Buddha? How much more so a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha?

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 142
The Analysis of Religious Donations

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an4.247:1.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekabuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatasāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho—
an4.247:1.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; an Independent Buddha; a disciple of a Realized One; and a wheel-turning monarch.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4.247
25. Perils of Offenses
Worthy of a Monument

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.16:1.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, paccekabuddho, ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhī, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, saddhānusārī, dhammānusārī, gotrabhū—
an10.16:1.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; an Independent Buddha; one freed both ways; one freed by wisdom; a direct witness; one attained to view; one freed by faith; a follower by faith; a follower of teachings; a lamb of the flock.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.16
2. A Protector
Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods

sn3.20:3.2.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ so, mahārāja, seṭṭhi gahapati taggarasikhiṁ nāma paccekasambuddhaṁ piṇḍapātena paṭipādesi.
sn3.20:3.2.en: Once upon a time, great king, that financier householder provided almsfood on behalf of an Independent Buddha named Tagarasikhī.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

ud5.3:11.2.pli: So uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto addasa tagarasikhiṁ paccekabuddhaṁ nagaraṁ piṇḍāya pavisantaṁ.
ud5.3:11.2.en: On his way to visit a park, he saw Tagarasikhī, an Independent Buddha, entering the city for alms.

mlDocs.title:

With Suppabuddha the Leper

kp8:15.3.en: the plane of an independent Buddha:

an2.56:1.3.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, paccekabuddho ca.
an2.56:1.3.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and an Independent Buddha.
